title: Lesson 3 - Dependencies create build order
summary: Explore how refs alone tell dbt which models run first.
description: dbt never reads join logic or infers meaning from aliases. It simply sees two ref() calls and knows those upstream models must finish before this one compiles.
concept: Build order is inferred from refs, not declared manually.

revealSections.title: What dbt learned
revealSections.body: Lineage shows stg_orders feeding this model before stg_customers can join. That's enough to schedule builds safely.

models.title: customer_orders
models.description: Read-only model for reasoning about build sequencing.
models.sql:
select *
from {{ ref('stg_orders') }} o
join {{ ref('stg_customers') }} c
  on o.customer_id = c.customer_id
